meanings.definition: The middle of the day; noon.
meanings.sent1: At midday, the sun is directly overhead.
meanings.sent3: The cat always naps at midday, just like clockwork.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, midday is when the streets come alive.
meanings.sent5: The farmer's fields shimmered under the midday sun.

meanings.definition: The time when the sun is highest in the sky.
meanings.sent1: During midday, shadows are at their shortest.
meanings.sent2: The heat is intense at midday in the desert.
meanings.sent3: The flowers in the garden bloom beautifully at midday.
meanings.sent4: In the peak of midday, the world seems to stand still.
meanings.sent5: The brightness of midday can be blinding without sunglasses.
